prompt: <description>Part 1: Three-Dimensional Rectangular Prism with a Flat Top and Bottom Step 1: Create the coordinate system Create a new coordinate system at the origin with: - Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] - Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] Step 2: Draw a 2D sketch Create a new 2D sketch at the XY plane of the coordinate system created in the previous step. Draw a line from point [0.7466, 0.75] to point [0.0, 0.75]. 4. Draw a line from point [0.0, 0.75] to point [0.0, 0.0]. Step 4: Create loops 1. Create a loop with line_1, line_2, line_3, and line_4 to form a closed rectangular shape. Step 5: Create faces 1. Create a face with the loop from the previous step. Step 6: Scale the 2D sketch Scale the 2D sketch by 0.75 as the scaling parameter: - sketch_scale: 0.75 Step 7: Transform and extrude the 2D sketch 1. Transform the scaled 2D sketch using the given euler angles [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] and the translation vector [0.0, 0.0, 0.0]. 2. Extrude the transformed 2D sketch by 0.0205 towards the normal and by 0.0 in the opposite direction of the normal: - extrude_depth_towards_normal: 0.0205 - extrude_depth_opposite_normal: 0.0 Part 1 Dimensions: - Length: 0.75 - Width: 0.75 - Height: 0.0205 The first part is a three-dimensional rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom, constructed using given steps and dimensions.</description>

<description>Part 1: Construction of a 3D model of a rectangular prism with a square cutout Step 1: Create a coordinate system Begin by creating a new coordinate system at the origin (0, 0, 0) with zero degrees of rotation and zero translation. Step 2: Draw 2D Sketch Draw a 2D sketch on the XY plane of the coordinate system. Step 3: Draw faces - Face 1: Draw a rectangle with four lines as follows: - Line 1: Start Point (0, 0), End Point (0.75, 0) - Line 2: Start Point (0.75, 0), End Point (0.75, 0.7492) - Line 3: Start Point (0.75, 0.7492), End Point (0, 0.7492) - Line 4: Start Point (0, 0.7492), End Point (0, 0) - Face 2: Draw a rectangle with four lines as follows: - Line 1: Start Point (0.117, 0.2021), End Point (0.633, 0.2021) - Line 2: Start Point (0.633, 0.2021), End Point (0.633, 0.5471) - Line 3: Start Point (0.633, 0.5471), End Point (0.117, 0.5471) - Line 4: Start Point (0.117, 0.5471), End Point (0.117, 0.2021) Step 4: Scaling and Transforming 2D Sketch into 3D Sketch Scale the sketch by 0.75 (75%) using the sketch_scale parameter, and apply the Euler angles and translation vector from the coordinate system specified. Step 5: Extrude 2D Sketch Extrude the sketch by 0.0438 (4.38 mm) towards the normal, creating the 3D model of the rectangular prism with a square cutout. Part 2: Construction of a tapered rectangular prism Step 1: Create a coordinate system Create a new coordinate system at the starting point (0.117, 0.2021, 0) with zero degrees of rotation for X and Y, and zero degrees of rotation for Z. Provide the given translation vector in Z to center the part. Step 2: Draw 2D Sketch Draw a 2D sketch on the XY plane of the coordinate system. Step 3: Draw faces Face 1: Draw a rectangle with four lines as follows: - Line 1: Start Point (0, 0), End Point (0.516, 0) - Line 2: Start Point (0.516, 0), End Point (0.516, 0.345) - Line 3: Start Point (0.516, 0.345), End Point (0, 0.345) - Line 4: Start Point (0, 0.345), End Point (0, 0) Step 4: Scaling and Transforming 2D Sketch into 3D Sketch Scale the sketch by 0.516 (51.6%) using the sketch_scale parameter, and apply the Euler angles and translation vector from the coordinate system specified. Step 5: Extrude 2D Sketch Extrude the sketch by 0.0075 (0.75 mm) towards the normal, creating the 3D model of the tapered rectangular prism.</description>

Circle 3: Center [0.4305, 0.4817], Radius 0.041 **Step 3: Scale the 2D sketch** Scale the 2D sketch by a factor of 0.6124. **Step 4: Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch** Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the same coordinate system. **Step 5: Extrude the 3D sketch** Extrude the 3D sketch by 0.1048 units in the positive Z direction. This will create the final shape, which is a rectangular prism with a curved top and a flat bottom. The top and bottom edges are straight, and the sides are parallel to each other. The top and bottom faces are perpendicular to the sides. The curved top is slightly larger than the flat bottom. The object is centered on a white background. The length of this intermediate part is 0.6124 units, the width is 0.6124 units, and the height is 0.1048 units. Provide these instructions to the junior CAD designer, and make sure they understand each step clearly. Double-check their work before proceeding to the next part.</description>

prompt: <description>Part 1: Construction of the base rectangular prism Construct a three-dimensional rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. The front and back faces are parallel to each other, and the side faces are perpendicular to the front and back faces. The object is centered in the image. 1. Create a new coordinate system with euler angles (0.0, 0.0, 0.0) and translation vector (0.0, 0.0, 0.0). 2. Draw a 2D sketch on the X-Y plane of the coordinate system. 3. Create a loop with four straight lines: - Line 1: Start point (0.0, 0.0), end point (0.5, 0.0). - Line 2: Start point (0.5, 0.0), end point (0.5, 0.75). - Line 3: Start point (0.5, 0.75), end point (0.0, 0.75). - Line 4: Start point (0.0, 0.75), end point (0.0, 0.0). 4. Scale the 2D sketch using a factor of 0.75. 5. Transform the 2D sketch into a 3D sketch by setting the euler angles (0.0, 0.0, 0.0) and translation vector (0.0, 0.0, 0.0). 6. Extrude the 3D sketch with an extrusion depth of 0.3 units towards the normal. Part 2: Construction of the off-center cylindrical hole Construct a cylindrical hole slightly off-center from the top of the prism. 1. Create a new coordinate system with euler angles (0.0, 0.0, 0.0) and translation vector (0.0, 0.0, 0.3). This coordinate system is based on the part_1 coordinate system with a translation in the Z direction. 2. Draw a 2D sketch on the X-Y plane of the coordinate system. 3. Create a loop with four straight lines: - Line 1: Start point (0.0, 0.0), end point (0.15, 0.0). - Line 2: Start point (0.15, 0.0), end point (0.15, 0.75). - Line 3: Start point (0.15, 0.75), end point (0.0, 0.75). - Line 4: Start point (0.0, 0.75), end point (0.0, 0.0). 4. Scale the 2D sketch using a factor of 0.75. 5. Transform the 2D sketch into a 3D sketch by setting the euler angles (0.0, 0.0, 0.0) and translation vector (0.0, 0.0, 0.0). 6. Extrude the 3D sketch with an extrusion depth of 0.15 units opposite the normal direction. Part 3: Construction of the off-center cylindrical hole Construct a cylindrical object slightly off-center to the right. 1. Create a new coordinate system with euler angles (0.0, 0.0, 0.0) and translation vector (0.225, 0.275, 0.3). This coordinate system is based on the part_2 coordinate system with a translation in the X and Y directions. 2. Draw a 2D sketch on the X-Y plane of the coordinate system. 3. Create a loop with a circle: - Circle 1: Center (0.1, 0.1), radius 0.1. 4. Scale the 2D sketch using a factor of 0.2. 5. Transform the 2D sketch into a 3D sketch by setting the euler angles (0.0, 0.0, 0.0) and translation vector (0.0, 0.0, 0.0). 6. Extrude the 3D sketch with an extrusion depth of 1.25 units opposite the normal direction. The final CAD assembly is obtained by combining the three individual parts constructed following the given instructions. The height of each part is as follows: part_1 (0.3), part_2 (0.15), and part_3 (1.25).</description>
